speaker: BARDOLPH
text: On, on, on, on, on! To the breach, to the

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: breach!

speaker: NYM
text: Pray thee, corporal, stay. The knocks are too hot,

speaker: NYM
text: and, for mine own part, I have not a case of lives.

speaker: NYM
text: The humor of it is too hot; that is the very plainsong

speaker: NYM
text: of it.

speaker: PISTOL
text: “The plainsong” is most just, for humors do

speaker: PISTOL
text: abound.

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Knocks
               
              go
               
              and
               
              come
              .
               
              God’s
               
              vassals
               
              drop
               
              and
               
              die
              ,

speaker: BOY
text: Would I were in an alehouse in London! I would

speaker: BOY
text: give all my fame for a pot of ale, and safety.

speaker: PISTOL
text: And I.

speaker: BOY
text:
BOY
            
            
               
              sings
            
            
              
                As
                 
                duly
                ,
              
              
                But
                 
                not
                 
                as
                 
                truly
                ,
              
              
                As
                 
                bird
                 
                doth
                 
                sing
                 
                on
                 
                bough
                .

speaker: FLUELLEN
text:
Up
               
              to
               
              the
               
              breach
              ,
               
              you
               
              dogs
              !
               
              Avaunt
              ,
               
              you
               
              cullions
              !

speaker: PISTOL
text: Be merciful, great duke, to men of mold. Abate

speaker: PISTOL
text: thy rage, abate thy manly rage, abate thy rage, great

speaker: PISTOL
text: duke. Good bawcock, ’bate thy rage. Use lenity,

speaker: PISTOL
text: sweet chuck.

speaker: NYM
text: These be good humors. Your Honor

speaker: NYM
text: wins bad humors.

speaker: BOY
text: As young as I am, I have observed these three

speaker: BOY
text: swashers. I am boy to them all three, but all they

speaker: BOY
text: three, though they would serve me, could not be

speaker: BOY
text: man to me. For indeed three such antics do not

speaker: BOY
text: amount to a man: for Bardolph, he is white-livered

speaker: BOY
text: and red-faced, by the means whereof he faces it out

speaker: BOY
text: but fights not; for Pistol, he hath a killing tongue

speaker: BOY
text: and a quiet sword, by the means whereof he breaks

speaker: BOY
text: words and keeps whole weapons; for Nym, he hath

speaker: BOY
text: heard that men of few words are the best men, and

speaker: BOY
text: therefore he scorns to say his prayers, lest he should

speaker: BOY
text: be thought a coward, but his few bad words are

speaker: BOY
text: matched with as few good deeds, for he never broke

speaker: BOY
text: any man’s head but his own, and that was against a

speaker: BOY
text: post when he was drunk. They will steal anything

speaker: BOY
text: and call it purchase. Bardolph stole a lute case, bore

speaker: BOY
text: it twelve leagues, and sold it for three halfpence.

speaker: BOY
text: Nym and Bardolph are sworn brothers in filching,

speaker: BOY
text: and in Calais they stole a fire shovel. I knew by that

speaker: BOY
text: piece of service the men would carry coals. They

speaker: BOY
text: would have me as familiar with men’s pockets as

speaker: BOY
text: their gloves or their handkerchers, which makes

speaker: BOY
text: much against my manhood, if I should take from

speaker: BOY
text: another’s pocket to put into mine, for it is plain

speaker: BOY
text: pocketing up of wrongs. I must leave them and seek

speaker: BOY
text: some better service. Their villainy goes against my

speaker: BOY
text: weak stomach, and therefore I must cast it up.

speaker: GOWER
text: Captain Fluellen, you must come presently to

speaker: GOWER
text: the mines; the Duke of Gloucester would speak

speaker: GOWER
text: with you.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: To the mines? Tell you the Duke it is not so

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: good to come to the mines, for, look you, the mines

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: is not according to the disciplines of the war. The

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: concavities of it is not sufficient, for, look you, th’

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: athversary, you may discuss unto the Duke, look

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: you, is digt himself four yard under the countermines.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: By Cheshu, I think he will plow up all if

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: there is not better directions.

speaker: GOWER
text: The Duke of Gloucester, to whom the order of

speaker: GOWER
text: the siege is given, is altogether directed by an

speaker: GOWER
text: Irishman, a very valiant gentleman, i’ faith.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: It is Captain Macmorris, is it not?

speaker: GOWER
text: I think it be.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: By Cheshu, he is an ass, as in the world. I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: will verify as much in his beard. He has no more

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: directions in the true disciplines of the wars, look

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: you, of the Roman disciplines, than is a puppy dog.

speaker: GOWER
text: Here he comes, and the Scots captain, Captain

speaker: GOWER
text: Jamy, with him.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Captain Jamy is a marvelous falorous gentleman,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: that is certain, and of great expedition and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: knowledge in th’ aunchient wars, upon my particular

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: knowledge of his directions. By Cheshu, he will

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: maintain his argument as well as any military man

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: in the world in the disciplines of the pristine wars

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: of the Romans.

speaker: JAMY
text: I say gudday, Captain Fluellen.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Godden to your Worship, good Captain

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: James.

speaker: GOWER
text: How now, Captain Macmorris, have you quit

speaker: GOWER
text: the mines? Have the pioners given o’er?

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: By Chrish, la, ’tish ill done. The work ish

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: give over. The trompet sound the retreat. By my

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: hand I swear, and my father’s soul, the work ish ill

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: done. It ish give over. I would have blowed up the

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: town, so Chrish save me, la, in an hour. O, ’tish ill

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: done, ’tish ill done, by my hand, ’tish ill done.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Captain Macmorris, I beseech you now,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: will you voutsafe me, look you, a few disputations

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: with you as partly touching or concerning the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: disciplines of the war, the Roman wars? In the way

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: of argument, look you, and friendly communication,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: partly to satisfy my opinion, and partly for the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: satisfaction, look you, of my mind, as touching the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: direction of the military discipline, that is the point.

speaker: JAMY
text: It sall be vary gud, gud feith, gud captens bath,

speaker: JAMY
text: and I sall quit you with gud leve, as I may pick

speaker: JAMY
text: occasion, that sall I, marry.

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: It is no time to discourse, so Chrish save

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: me. The day is hot, and the weather, and the wars,

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: and the King, and the dukes. It is no time to

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: discourse. The town is beseeched. An the trumpet

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: call us to the breach and we talk and, be Chrish, do

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: nothing, ’tis shame for us all. So God sa’ me, ’tis

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: shame to stand still. It is shame, by my hand. And

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: there is throats to be cut, and works to be done,

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: and there ish nothing done, so Christ sa’ me, la.

speaker: JAMY
text: By the Mess, ere theise eyes of mine take themselves

speaker: JAMY
text: to slomber, ay’ll de gud service, or I’ll lig i’

speaker: JAMY
text: th’ grund for it, ay, or go to death. And I’ll pay ’t as

speaker: JAMY
text: valorously as I may, that sall I suerly do, that is the

speaker: JAMY
text: breff and the long. Marry, I wad full fain heard

speaker: JAMY
text: some question ’tween you tway.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Captain Macmorris, I think, look you, under

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: your correction, there is not many of your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: nation—

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: Of my nation? What ish my nation? Ish a

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: villain and a basterd and a knave and a rascal. What

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: ish my nation? Who talks of my nation?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Look you, if you take the matter otherwise

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: than is meant, Captain Macmorris, peradventure I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: shall think you do not use me with that affability as,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: in discretion, you ought to use me, look you, being

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: as good a man as yourself, both in the disciplines of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: war and in the derivation of my birth, and in other

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: particularities.

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: I do not know you so good a man as

speaker: MACMORRIS
text: myself. So Chrish save me, I will cut off your head.

speaker: GOWER
text: Gentlemen both, you will mistake each other.

speaker: JAMY
text: Ah, that’s a foul fault.

speaker: GOWER
text: The town sounds a parley.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Captain Macmorris, when there is more

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: better opportunity to be required, look you, I will

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: be so bold as to tell you I know the disciplines of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: war, and there is an end.
